14.heading: Le Beau.
14.title: "Jack on the Renegade Trail"
14.author: [No author]
14.series: Jack) p. 20-25 in Treasure Chest of Fun and Fact, v. 4, no. 8
notes: "What has gone before: Jack Cheval has joined Landeau and Brave Hawk who are conducting the Indian Chief Limping Rabbit to a good hunting ground. On the way the party discovers that Manitok, a renegade, is planning to steal trader Le Beau's furs. When Jack leaves the party to spy on Manitok he is attacked by a wounded moose."

80.heading: LeBrun, Denis, 1958-
80.title: "Aesthetics"

notes: Summary: Dagwood waits to find out if the dress is on sale before he says whether he likes it.

81.heading: LeBrun, Denis, 1958-
81.title: "Blondie"
81.author: Denis LeBrun
notes: Summary: LeBrun writes about Blondie and working with Dean Young. Photographs of both men, and pencilled and finished examples of the strip.

82.heading: LeBrun, Denis, 1958-
82.title: "Cool"
82.author: Young & Lebrun.
notes: Summary: Dagwood is exasperated that the kids' vocabulary seems to be reduced to the word 'cool;' Blondie thinks he's exaggerating.

83.heading: LeBrun, Denis, 1958-
83.title: "Hold the Mail"
83.author: Young and LeBrun.
notes: Summary: Dagwood doesn't want any bills during his vacation, even though he's staying home.

84.heading: LeBrun, Denis, 1958-
84.title: "Same to You, Buddy!"
84.author: Young and LeBrun.
notes: Summary: A mind-reader comes to Dagwood's door, and leaves without making a sale.

85.heading: LeBrun, Denis, 1958-
85.title: "Stick with the Flowers"
85.author: Young & Lebrun.
notes: Summary: In bed with Blondie, Dagwood describes the nicest part of his day in terms of hugs and flowers, then remembers the pork chops.

86.heading: LeBrun, Denis, 1958-
86.title: "Stuck in his Throat"
86.author: Young & LeBrun.
notes: Summary: Dagwood wants to tell off Mr. Dithers, but the words won't come out.

87.heading: LeBrun, Denis, 1958-
87.title: "Surf and Turf in That Place must be Sardines and Salami!"
87.author: Young & Lebrun.
notes: Summary: Mr. Dithers insults the lunch counter where Dagwood usually eats.

88.heading: LeBrun, Denis, 1958-
88.title: "That's What We're Here For"
88.author: Young and LeBrun.
notes: Summary: Dagwood calls for technical support for his computer, and is comforted to hear a human voice; he's talking to Dogbert of the Dilbert strip.

89.heading: LeBrun, Denis, 1958- --Miscellanea.
89.title: "Silver Linings"
89.author: by Al Hormel
89.appears_in: p. 26-29 in Hogan's Alley, v. 2, no. 1 (=no. 5) (1998).
notes: Summary: Describes the success of artists who have taken over established comic strips, including Bud Sagendorf and Bobby London (Popeye), Jim Raymond, Stan Drake and Denis LeBrun (Blondie), Dick Moores and Jim Scancarelli (Gasoline Alley), Leonard Starr (Annie), Selby Kelly (Pogo), George Wunder (Terry and the Pirates), Jerry Scott and Guy and Brad Gilchrist (Nancy)

Subjects: Belgian comics, European comics, biography.

143.heading: Lecigne, Bruno, 1957-
143.title: "Quelle Critique pour la Bande Dessinée?" p. 52-55 in Les Cahiers de la Bande Dessinée, no. 63
143.author: [No author]
notes: Transcribes a round table discussion among members of the magazine's staff, on the state of Franco-Belgian comics criticism. Participants are: Jacques Samson, Thierry Smolderen, Thierry Groensteen, Claude Ecken, Bruno Lecigne, Arnaud de la Croix, and Sylvain Bouyer. Photographs are included of Pierre Sterckx, Smolderen, Anita Van Belle, De la Croix, Daniel Hugues, Groensteen, Lecigne, and Bouyer.

145.author: [No author]

notes: Recommendations of the work by Yslaire (=Bernard Hislaire) & Balac (=Yann Le Pennetier), by Thierry Groensteen, Bruno Lecigne, Luc Dellisse and Arnaud de la Croix, and a 5-question interview with the creators.
